channel.title: Gtx 770/780?
channel.description:
Are there any retailers that are selling these two cards yet?
http://www.tomshardware.com/reviews/geforce-gtx-770-gk104-review,3519.html
it appears the 680 has finally been brought down. The 780 from what I have been seeing will be cheaper than the counterpart 680 as well!

item.title: Gtx 770/780?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:26, topic:520436”]eh a lot of games will automatically adjust to like 1024x800 or something like that. Which isn’t too overly bad I guess but I still prefer 800x600 to be honest. (I actually have a REALLY old computer where I can input to 600x400 xD…)

if the 660ti will work perfectly I will just keep that. Do I need any specific cpu?[/quote]
Anything above the i5 3570k will be perfectly adequate for many years to come, the i7 3770k (what I have) is a little better with not too much of a huge price difference

Read full topic

item.title: Gtx 770/780?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

eh a lot of games will automatically adjust to like 1024x800 or something like that. Which isn’t too overly bad I guess but I still prefer 800x600 to be honest. (I actually have a REALLY old computer where I can input to 600x400 xD…)

if the 660ti will work perfectly I will just keep that. Do I need any specific cpu?

Read full topic

item.title: Gtx 770/780?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:24, topic:520436”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=638932.msg4307291#msg4307291 date=1370113860]
I don’t own Far Cry 3, but my friend can easily pull 50fps @ 1080 with an i5-3570k and 560 Ti. So you don’t need the high end i7, the 3770 would suffice, and the 660 Ti should be more than plenty to do what you want. But once you play games at 1080 you’ll never want to go to a lower resolution.
[/quote]Actually I would LOVE to play games @ 1080 my issue is vision issues which hinders my gameplay for larger resolutions/chatting.

[quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=638932.msg4307230#msg4307230 date=1370088797]
L&P you’re bloody insane, you don’t need a 780 to play games at 800x600 for love’s sake, don’t even get me started on the 3930x
[/quote]okay can I get some ideas about what I would need for high end gaming on a lower resolution please?

Most benchmarks refer to higher resolutions.[/quote]
You could play any game in the world at over 60 FPS with your 660TI at 800x600 (do games even support that anymore?!)

Read full topic

So you don’t need the high end i7, the 3770 would suffice, and the 660 Ti should be more than plenty to do what you want. But once you play games at 1080 you’ll never want to go to a lower resolution.[/quote]Actually I would LOVE to play games @ 1080 my issue is vision issues which hinders my gameplay for larger resolutions/chatting.

item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

I don’t own Far Cry 3, but my friend can easily pull 50fps @ 1080 with an i5-3570k and 560 Ti. So you don’t need the high end i7, the 3770 would suffice, and the 660 Ti should be more than plenty to do what you want. But once you play games at 1080 you’ll never want to go to a lower resolution.

item.title: Gtx 770/780?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:14, topic:520436”]what do you need a high end for? Unless you plan on streaming and playing at 1080 its a pretty wasteful move imo.[/quote]http://pcpartpicker.com/p/11AIo

that was my original build I was going to go with.

After reading the post about the 400$ beast though it is making me reconsider…I could get one of those for 400$ that would save me a TON of cash.

Edit: and I probably won’t be playing in 1080…it will probably be either 800x600 or like 1024x700-800 but I want to make sure I can hit at least 50 fps in EVERY game I try to play. Can you guys think of a better route?

[quote=“The Enforcer, post:15, topic:520436”]EVGA’s GTX 780 SC scores better than TITAN.[/quote]I saw that too but I believe the Titan would perform better for most games but maybe I am just looking at the benchmarks wrong?

Read full topic

item.title: Gtx 770/780?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:10, topic:520436”]so your building a desktop yeah?

Also, I guess if you want to upgrade it should be only around $100 difference. I don’t know the exact spec differences(though I don’t imagine them to be too much higher) wouldn’t be a horrible thing, but in terms of better graphics I don’t see too much(provided you’re getting the 770)[/quote]I plan on building one in about six months o_0

I didn’t think about it but I guess I should had just bought the graphic card last lol… I may return the 660ti and purchase a 3930x extreme or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Gtx 770/780?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:

[quote=“casey., post:8, topic:520436”]660TI works fine for most casual games. Should run any game that isn’t too high on GPU pretty well.

What CPU do you have?[/quote]Don’t have one yet Like I said I still have the 660ti still in the actual box cause I just recently purchased it I was planning on buying a new part every month.

item.title: Gtx 770/780?

660TI works fine for most casual games. Should run any game that isn’t too high on GPU pretty well. I’m sorry but I don’t see the need to run out and upgrade your graphic card.

item.title: Gtx 770/780?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

I currently have a 660TI (not in an actual computer yet but I have one…)

However then I got a news report in my email when these came out a little while ago. So now my issue is that after looking at these benchmarks and stuff I just don’t know if I should upgrade to a 690, get a Titan, or go for one of these babies. Either way my mindset is “either four of those possibilities will hold any firepower I throw at it”

Read full topic

item.title: Gtx 770/780?
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

[B]At $649, the GTX 780 [/B]is priced much higher than its direct ancestor, and it aims to approach Titan-level performance without hitting the same thousand-dollar high. Meanwhile, the [B]GTX 770 costs just $399[/B] and yet is said to replace last year's flagship cards like the GTX 680 and Radeon HD 7970 GHz Edition, which are still being sold for $450 and upwards at some retailers.

Why is this expensive? uh…top end graphic card?
When will it go down? as new/better cards come out?

Are you trying to build/buy a setup with these cards in them?

Read full topic

item.title: Gtx 770/780?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:4, topic:520436”]So whats your question?

780’s are also going for a modest $700[/quote]My question is this…

According to

Engadget

NVIDIA GeForce GTX 770 and 780 review roundup: Kepler's still kicking in 2013

Now that we have the low-down on NVIDIA's two mainstream heavyweights, the GTX 770 and the GTX 780, we figure it's time to move beyond specs and official slid...

it states that the 780 will be going for 400$ yet as you even said I have been seeing 650-700$ Why is this? When will it lower? etc.

Read full topic
